Neuroptimus

inference module

class inference.Bayesian_inference(parent)
resample()

Used for sampling within the datset Created if current system cannot support high computations so smaller sample is considered .

labelser()

stores the parameter names used for computations. used for plotting purpouses..

recompute_dt()

Computes the new dt for the resampled data

auto_corr_func()

Calculates the autocorrelation of noise

cov_mat()

Calculates the covariance matrix on the basis of noise parameter

inv_cov_mat()

Calculates the inverse of the covariance matrix for the coloured gaussian noise

diagonal_cov_mat()

Calculates the covariance and incovariance matrix of the white noise

generate_time_vector()

returns the list of time points , utilizes dt, start-time and end-time.

compute_covariance()

Branching decision function which calls either the inv_covariance function or the diagonal_cov_mat() function on the basis of type of noise

log_prior()

Returns the sum of log pdf of the parameters

log_likelihood()

Calculates the log likelihood of the data given the parameters

log_probability()

Calculates the sum of log prior and log likelihood and returns it

return_mcmc_and_plot_samples()

Does sampling using mcmc (emcee library used) , it also calculates the map(maximum posteriori)

plotting()

Constructs the probabilty distribution plots of the mcmc results

run_variational_inference()

performs variational inference algorithm by trying to find parameters that satisfies the target distribution.

plotvi()

Plot contour distribution for variational inference(probaility(a)/probabilty(b))

run_inference()

Runs the likelihood free algorithm called approximate bayesian inference(abcpy library used)

plot_results()

Probability distribution of abc algorithm

class inference.Simulation(parent)
check_input()
check_output()
forward_simulate()

Foward simulation for abc algorithm
